Data Loader Module¶

aaanalysis.data_loader.load_dataset(name='INFO', n=None, non_canonical_aa='remove', min_len=None, max_len=None)[source]¶

Load one of the following protein sequence benchmarking datasets.

Load general information about datasets by setting ‘name’ to ‘INFO’.

Parameters¶

namestr

Name of the dataset (‘Dataset’ column).

nint, optional

Number of proteins per class. If None, the whole dataset will be returned.

non_canonical_aa: {‘remove’, ‘keep’, ‘gap’}, str, default=’remove’

Options for modifying non-canonical amino acids: - ‘remove’: Sequences containing non-canonical amino acids are removed - ‘keep’: Sequences containing non-canonical amino acids are not removed - ‘gap’: Sequences are kept and modified by replacing non-canonical amino acids by gap symbol (‘X’)

min_lenint, optional

Minimum length of sequences used for filtering.

max_lenint, optional

Maximum length of sequences used for filtering.

Returns¶

dfDataFrame

Dataframe with the selected dataset.

aaanalysis.data_loader.load_scales(name='scales', just_aaindex=False, unclassified_in=True)[source]¶

Load amino acid scales or scale classification.

Parameters¶

namestr, default=’scales’

Name of the dataset to load. Options are ‘scales’, ‘scales_raw’, ‘scale_classification’, ‘scales_pc’, ‘top60’, and ‘top60_eval’.

unclassified_inbool, optional

Whether unclassified scales should be included. The ‘Others’ category counts as unclassified. Only relevant if name is ‘scales’, ‘scales_raw’, or ‘scale_classification’.

just_aaindexbool, optional

Whether only scales provided from AAindex should be given. Only relevant if name is ‘scales’, ‘scales_raw’, or ‘scale_classification’.

Returns¶

dfDataFrame

Dataframe for the selected dataset.
